flawed_nl_solution:
He needs 48 pounds of flour because 12 x 4 = <<12*4=48>>48
He needs 3.93 bags of 10 pound bags because 48 / 10 = <<48/10=3.93>>3.93
He therefore needs to buy 4 bags of flour because 3 < 3.93 < 4
He spends $40 if he buys this flour because 4 x 10 = <<4*10=40>>40
He needs 4 bags of the 12-pound flour because 48 / 12 = <<48/12=4>>4
He would spend $52 on the 12-pound bags because 4 x 13 = 52
He spends $40 if he buys the cheapest flour because 40 < 52
#### 40

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 4.8, not 3.9264056744. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
